page.title: 06MODERN FARMING, STRENSHAM.
page.content: The landowners, mostly insurance companies or pension funds, are more interested in the land than the buildings some of which, including barns, fall into a bad state of repair. The widespread use of machinery on farms now means that fewer people are needed to work on the land. A 500 acre farm can now be managed by the owner, plus two workmen. The farms no longer need so many{'tied' cottages}and these are readily bought by city workers thus pushing up prices. The proximity of the{M5}has brought to this rural area commuters who work in the surrounding large towns. The farms in this area are either arable, dairy or a combi- nation of both. Main crops are{wheat,} {barley}or{food for livestock.}Some farms retain their orchards of apple, pear or plum but woodland is sparse.
